description: Latin con- + notatus, past participle of notare (“to mark”). Compare connote.

verbs.description: connotate (third-person singular simple present connotates, present participle connotating, simple past and past participle connotated)

entries.meaning: To connote; to suggest or designate (something) as additional or representative; to imply.
examples: George stared at her curiously. To his mind the word rompers connotated a garment extraneously smeared, as this one.
